metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3525 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Apache Traffic Server 3.x through 3.2.5, 4.x before 4.2.1.1, and 5.x before 5.0.1 has unknown impact and attack vectors, possibly related to health checks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 5.0.1-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 5.0.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.1-1').
